candidates.title: Bump hyper-util from 0.1.3 to 0.1.4

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [hyper-util](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util) from 0.1.3 to 0.1.4.
Release notes

Sourced from hyper-util's releases.

v0.1.4

What's Changed

  • Add initial_max_send_streams() to legacy client builder
  • Add max_pending_accept_reset_streams() to legacy client builder
  • Add max_headers(usize) to auto server builder
  • Add http1_onl() and http2_only() to auto server builder
  • Add connection capturing API to legacy client
  • Add impl Connection for TokioIo
  • Fix graceful shutdown hanging on reading the HTTP version

New Contributors

  • @​magurotuna made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#87
  • @​ikrivosheev made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#90
  • @​elpiel made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#103
  • @​mladedav made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#106
  • @​wfly1998 made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#107
  • @​CobaltCause made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#110
  • @​hasezoey made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#114
  • @​MaxFangX made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#116
  • @​kvinwang made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#117
  • @​martinetd made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#113
  • @​rcoh made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#112
  • @​allan2 made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#102
  • @​FabijanC made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#120

Full Changelog: https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util/compare/v0.1.3...v0.1.4

Changelog

Sourced from hyper-util's changelog.

0.1.4 (2024-05-24)

  • Add initial_max_send_streams() to legacy client builder
  • Add max_pending_accept_reset_streams() to legacy client builder
  • Add max_headers(usize) to auto server builder
  • Add http1_onl() and http2_only() to auto server builder
  • Add connection capturing API to legacy client
  • Add impl Connection for TokioIo
  • Fix graceful shutdown hanging on reading the HTTP version
Commits
  • 3f6a92e v0.1.4
  • 1635bcc feat: add {http1,http2}_only for auto conn (#111)
  • 4b24573 bump hyper to v1.3.0 (#122)
  • f1142a4 docs: Fix typo in legacy/client.rs (#120)
  • 5688b27 feat: adds max_pending_accept_reset_streams for legacy (#102)
  • a77d866 feat(client): Add connection capturing API to hyper-util (#112)
  • f87fe0d feat(auto): allow serving connection with upgrades after config (#113)
  • 7bae87f feat: impl Connection for TokioIo (#117)
  • a566eb0 doc: minor: Fix TokioIo doc
  • 564ae12 fix: disable default features for dep "tower"
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=hyper-util&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.1.3&new-version=0.1.4)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) You can trigger a rebase of this PR by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. candidates.title: improve error logic of rama

milestone.title: v0.2
milestone.description: First release where rama is actually useful.

candidates.body: Closes #154

candidates.title: update deps: replaced futures crate with futures_lite
candidates.body:
Should close #150 by replacing `futures` and `futures-core` crate with `futures_lite` crate.

Could not replace `futures_util` crate, as I did not find an easy way to replace `futures_util::TryStream`.
The farthest I got was replacing
```
where
    S: TryStream,
    S::Ok: Into<Bytes>,
    S::Error: Into<BoxError>,
```
with 
```
where
  S: Stream<Item = Result<Bytes, BoxError>>
```

But that created more problems than solutions. I am open to guidance on this task.

Also, not sure how to fix clippy warning:

```
warning: unused `std::result::Result` in tuple element 0 that must be used
   --> src/stream/layer/tracker/bytes.rs:403:9
    |
403 |         futures_lite::future::zip(task_1, task_2).await;
    |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    |
    = note: this `Result` may be an `Err` variant, which should be handled
    = note: `#[warn(unused_must_use)]` on by default
```

Is ignoring the result the solution to go?

candidates.title: implement a default ProxyDB implementation using venndb
candidates.body:
TODO:

* [x] add layer / service implementation to inject a Proxy into the Req/Context
* [x] add unit tests
* [x] fix any other newly introduced TODO's

Closes #19

candidates.title: add test for http_listener_hello and http_conn_state
candidates.body:
Hi, @GlenDC, I want to challenge #53  issue.
As an experiment, a test was created against `http_listener_hello.rs`.
I would like to know your thought about how to call example.
I'm concerned that the tests take a lot of times for examples be compiled.

candidates.title: Implement `HttpMatcher::and` and `HttpMatcher::or`
candidates.body:
Addresses part of  https://github.com/plabayo/rama/issues/92 and https://github.com/plabayo/rama/issues/93 for `http` layer.

- Modifies `HttpMatcherKind::All` and `HttpMatcherKind::Any` variants to contain `Vec<HttpMatcher>` instead of `Vec<HttpKind>`. This way the negation of each matcher is preserved, and this fixes the bug I mentioned in the above issue.
- Implements `HttpMatcher::and` and `HttpMatcher::or` methods.
- Updates existing `HttpMatcher::and_*` and `HttpMatcher::or_*` methods to use new methods.
- Adds `HttpKind::Custom(_)` variant for custom matcher implementations.
- Adds tests.

candidates.title: Use workspace dependencies where possible
candidates.body:
Fix #89.

I took `cargo-autoinherit` for a spin since there was an open issue about it 😁

candidates.title: initial version of the rama-fp web service
candidates.body: Closes #60

candidates.title: initial upgrade support
candidates.body:
Closes #17 

Internal code to be revisited once we have integrated hyper into the rama codebase (#86).

candidates.title: Feat/84 context methods
candidates.body:
PR to integrate original PR #84 into main branch.

Closes #70

candidates.title: Recreate pull request for get_or_nsert and the other associated functions
candidates.body:
Welp that was an accident. Today I learned discarding changes when syncing a fork deletes the associated PR. Anyway I'll reiterate what I said in my original PR:
Thank you for your time and patience @GlenDC and I apologize for the radio silence. I managed to `get_or_insert` working and moved the core logic into `Extensions` as you suggested. I got stuck on the implementation of `get_or_insert_with` so that is really the only thing left on the table for this PR. `get_or_insert_default` uses `get_or_insert_with` internally, so that one won't work either till the crash on `get_or_insert_with` is fixed. (I'm sure there's a better way to write `get_or_insert_with` too but I got stuck 😅 )

candidates.title: #30: support limit middleware
candidates.body: Closes #30

candidates.title: #71: support generic service matcher util code
candidates.body: Closes #71

candidates.title: implement new design around stable Rust w/o tower
candidates.body: and move all examples to the new design

candidates.title: introduce rama-rt to isolate runtime (tokio) usage
candidates.body:
Initial issue for #6, which will also be the only work for now,
as for now we'll continue to just use and support tokio.

chosen_pr.title: Bump tokio-util from 0.7.10 to 0.7.11

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

chosen_pr.body:
Bumps [tokio-util](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 0.7.10 to 0.7.11.
Commits
  • cdf9d99 chore: prepare tokio-util v0.7.11 (#6535)
  • f6eb1ee time: lazily init timers on first poll (#6512)
  • b7d4fba sync: add mpsc::Receiver::{capacity,max_capacity} (#6511)
  • 3c8d8e6 chore: fix latest rust-1.78.0 warnings (#6528)
  • e971a5e util: use FIFO ordering in WakeList (#6521)
  • 28439e2 time: clean up implementation (#6517)
  • d33fdd8 time: check for overflow in Interval::poll_tick (#6487)
  • 731dde2 runtime: clarify misleading use of UnsafeCell::with_mut (#6513)
  • 9ed5957 wasm: support rt-multi-thread with wasm32-wasi-preview1-threads (#6510)
  • a73d6bf macros: #[cfg(not(test))] is no longer necessary for main macros (#6508)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
